Summary (Short)

All sales are final. Novaqy Cloud LLP does not accept returns, exchanges, or refunds for purchases of licenses, digital goods, or physical products ordered through our site, except where explicitly required by applicable law or where a manufacturer or supplier warranty applies.

Suppliers for certain products may include third parties whose policies restrict returns or refunds. By completing a purchase you acknowledge and accept that supplier policies may restrict returns and refunds.

No Returns / No Refunds

Unless otherwise required by applicable law, all purchases are final and non‑refundable. No partial refunds will be issued unless explicitly authorized in writing by an officer of Novaqy Cloud LLP. This policy applies to license purchases from suppliers whose terms prohibit returns and refunds.

Eligibility for Exceptions (Placeholder)

The only potential exceptions to the "no refund" rule are:

  1. When required by applicable consumer protection law; or
  2. When a manufacturer or supplier warranty applies and the supplier or manufacturer authorizes a remedy (repair, replacement, or refund); or
  3. Documented billing errors confirmed by Novaqy Cloud LLP.

Any purported exception must be requested by emailing [CONTACT_EMAIL] within the timeframe stated by the relevant warranty or law and must include full documentation (order number, proof of purchase, supplier invoice, photos, serial numbers, etc.).

How to Submit a Claim

To request a review for a warranty claim or billing error, provide the following to [CONTACT_EMAIL]:

  • Order number and purchase date
  • Proof of purchase (receipt / invoice)
  • Description of the issue and supporting evidence (photos, logs)
  • Supplier invoice showing supplier name when applicable

Submissions that do not include required documentation may be rejected without further review.

Chargeback & Dispute Defense (Developer / Admin Guidance)

We maintain detailed records to defend against chargebacks and payment disputes. When a customer completes checkout they have explicitly accepted our Terms and Privacy Policy, and the system records the acceptance evidence (timestamp, IP, user-agent, and terms version).

DEV NOTE:
  • Acceptance metadata is recorded in Stripe Checkout session metadata and persisted to our orders table. See /api/create-checkout-session and /api/finalize-order.
  • Attach supplier invoice(s), license activation logs, delivery confirmations, and email threads to the corresponding order record to strengthen dispute evidence.
  • Keep evidence retention and export capabilities (order JSON + Stripe session JSON + supplier invoice) available for at least 18–24 months.
  • Ensure Stripe statement descriptor is consistent and recognizable to reduce consumer confusion (set STRIPE_STATEMENT_DESCRIPTOR).

No Partial Refunds

Partial refunds are not permitted except in the limited and documented circumstances expressly approved in writing by an authorized representative of Novaqy Cloud LLP or as required by applicable law.
